segments.text: Tomorrow is Halloween , I know I'm ready . I bought two pumpkins and a big bags of candy . Do you want to help me a jack-o-lantern ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I'd love to . I heard about Halloween when I was in Beijing . It's kind of a children's day . Small kids get dressed up , then walk around with paper bags or baskets , knocking on the neighbor's
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: They are supposed to say trick or treat ? Then the neighbors are supposed to hand up the candy .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: That's kind of cool . But what's the trick mean ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Usually it's the older kids going around playing Halloween , like punching the pumpkins left outside people's doors or - - someone's tree . They usually do it late at night after little kids go
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: That sounds kind of fun , maybe I can get tighter with my friends that night .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Usually be adults , you don't have kids have a big party in get dressed up too .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: That does sound a lot of fun .
segments.speaker: S2
